oai_dc:dc.dc:title: On dissipative SISO systems: a behavioral approach
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: PENDHARKAR, ISHAN
PILLAI, HARISH K
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: differential equations
behavioral research
matrix algebra
transfer functions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The behavioral equivalent of SISO systems are behaviors with two manifest variables. In this paper we investigate behaviors with two manifest variables that are dissipative with respect to a supply rate induced by a quadratic differential form (QDF). These QDFs define some relation between the input, the output and their derivatives of a SISO system. We characterize all behaviors that are dissipative with respect to the prescribed supply rate. In fact, we parametrize all the behaviors dissipative with respect to the prescribed supply rate in terms of those that are dissipative with respect to a "special" QDF. Similar results can also be given for lossless systems.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Proceedings of the 42nd IEEE Conference on Decision and Control (V 2), Mauli, USA, 9-12 December 2003, 1616-1620
